sn46.8:4.1: At one time Venerables Upavāna and Sāriputta were staying near Kosambi, in Ghosita’s Monastery.
sn46.8:4.2: Then in the late afternoon, Venerable Sāriputta came out of solitude, went to Venerable Upavāna
sn46.8:4.4: When the greetings and polite conversation were over, he sat down to one side,
sn46.8:5.1: “Reverend Upavāna, can a mendicant know through their own rational attention that the seven awakening factors are well implemented and lead to living at ease?”
sn46.8:6.1: As a mendicant rouses up the awakening factor of mindfulness, they understand: ‘My mind is well freed. I’ve eradicated dullness and drowsiness, and eliminated restlessness and remorse. My energy is roused up, and my mind is sharply focused, not sluggish. …
sn46.8:6.2: As they rouse up the awakening factor of mindfulness, they understand: ‘My mind is well freed. I’ve eradicated dullness and drowsiness, and eliminated restlessness and remorse. My energy is roused up, and my mind is sharply focused, not sluggish.’
sn46.8:6.3: That’s how a mendicant can know through their own rational attention that the seven awakening factors are well implemented and lead to living at ease.”
